Description: This is a circular pottery oil lamp without a raised base. Small nozzle for pouring on one edge. Indented centre that is pierced with a small hole, off-centre. Moulded decoration in the centre, and a ridge around the outside. Moulded lamp with purple slip. Light brown fabric with white inclusions, rare mica and quartz.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by City Art Gallery and Museum, Bristol. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Probably Egyptian, maybe a mixture of marl and silt fabrics as this is pale for silt, but too silty for marl. Unprovenanced parallels in the British Museum (Bailey 1988, British Museum Lamps III, nos Q2011 - Q2017), copying Loeschcke Type VIII. Loeschcke, S. 1919. Lampen aus Vindonissa. Zϋrich.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KE.17) (Phase 1)
